profile.name: VictoriaMetrics
profile.bio: Easy to use and fast monitoring solution

analysis.career_trajectory: Started with Python in 2020, pivoted to Rust systems programming in late 2023, and has been actively contributing to various open-source projects related to time series data, monitoring, and logging.

technical_obsessions.evidence: ['[2025-12-03] metricsql: Standalone PromQL and MetricsQL parser (Lang: Go)']
['[2026-01-14] ansible-playbooks: Ansible Playbooks for Victoria Metrics monorepo (Lang: Makefile)', '[2026-01-17] operator: Kubernetes operator for Victoria Metrics (Lang: Go)']
['[2025-12-03] metricsql: Standalone PromQL and MetricsQL parser (Lang: Go)', '[2026-01-16] victoriametrics-datasource: Grafana datasource for VictoriaMetrics (Lang: TypeScript)']

comment_analytics.communication_style: Asks deep architectural questions, provides detailed explanations of technical concepts, and supports others in their work.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: A developer who is passionate about systems programming, open-source contributions, and has a strong interest in monitoring and logging.
conversation_starters: What are some common challenges you face when implementing sharding in your database?
How do you approach debugging complex issues with Kubernetes operators?
Can you walk me through your experience with Prometheus and Grafana?
